intro: Diasperus coluteoides, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its latex contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Despite its toxicity, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
